name: Microsoft Planner
description: Microsoft Planner integration for managing plans, tasks, and buckets in Microsoft 365

list_groups.description: List all Microsoft 365 groups the authenticated user is a member of

limit.description: Maximum number of groups to return (default: 100)

error.description: Error message if the action failed

get_user_by_email.description: Get user information by email address to retrieve their user ID. Use this action when someone says 'assign to john@company.com' or mentions a specific email - you'll need the user_id from this response to use in task assignments.

email.description: The email address of the user to look up

user.description: Full user object from Microsoft Graph

error.description: Error message if the action failed

search_users.description: Search for users by display name or email to find their user IDs. Use this action when someone says 'assign to Sarah' or 'find user John Smith' - you'll need the user_id from the results to use in task assignments.

limit.description: Maximum number of users to return (default: 10)

users.description: List of matching users with their IDs, names, and emails

error.description: Error message if the action failed

get_current_user.description: Get the currently authenticated user's information including their user_id. Use this action when someone says 'assign to me' or 'create task for me' - you'll need the user_id from this response to use in assignments.

user.description: Full user object from Microsoft Graph

error.description: Error message if the action failed

list_user_tasks.description: List all tasks assigned to a user. By default, returns tasks for the currently authenticated user - no user_id needed!

user_id.description: Optional: The ID of a specific user to get tasks for. If not provided, returns tasks for the currently authenticated user. You can also use 'me' explicitly for current user.

tasks.description: List of tasks assigned to the user

error.description: Error message if the action failed

list_user_plans.description: List all plans shared with a user. By default, returns plans for the currently authenticated user - no user_id needed!

user_id.description: Optional: The ID of a specific user to get plans for. If not provided, returns plans for the currently authenticated user. You can also use 'me' explicitly for current user.

plans.description: List of plans shared with the user

error.description: Error message if the action failed

list_plans.description: List all plans owned by a specific group

group_id.description: The ID of the group that owns the plans

error.description: Error message if the action failed

get_plan.description: Get details of a specific plan by its ID

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan to retrieve

error.description: Error message if the action failed

create_plan.description: Create a new plan in a Microsoft 365 group

group_id.description: The ID of the Microsoft 365 group that will own the plan

container.description: Optional container object. If not provided, will be built from group_id. Example: {'containerId': 'group-id', 'type': 'group'}

error.description: Error message if the action failed

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan to update

title.description: The new title for the plan

error.description: Error message if the action failed

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan to delete

error.description: Error message if the action failed

plan_details.description: Plan details including category descriptions and sharing info

update_plan_details.description: Update plan details including category descriptions and sharing information

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan to update details for

category_descriptions.description: Object mapping category names (category1-25) to description strings

shared_with.description: Object mapping user IDs to sharing detail objects

error.description: Error message if the action failed

list_buckets.description: List all buckets in a specific plan

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan to get buckets from

error.description: Error message if the action failed

get_bucket.description: Get details of a specific bucket by its ID

bucket_id.description: The ID of the bucket to retrieve

error.description: Error message if the action failed

create_bucket.description: Create a new bucket in a plan

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan to create the bucket in

order_hint.description: Hint for ordering the bucket in the list. Use ' !' for default ordering

error.description: Error message if the action failed

bucket_id.description: The ID of the bucket to update

name.description: The new name for the bucket

error.description: Error message if the action failed

delete_bucket.description: Delete a bucket from a plan

bucket_id.description: The ID of the bucket to delete

error.description: Error message if the action failed

list_bucket_tasks.description: List all tasks in a specific bucket

bucket_id.description: The ID of the bucket to get tasks from

tasks.description: List of tasks in the bucket

list_tasks.description: List all tasks in a specific plan

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan to get tasks from

error.description: Error message if the action failed

get_task.description: Get details of a specific task by its ID

task_id.description: The ID of the task to retrieve

error.description: Error message if the action failed

create_task.description: Create a new task in a plan. To assign the task during creation, you must use actual Microsoft user IDs (GUIDs). First call get_current_user, get_user_by_email, or search_users to get user IDs before creating the task.

plan_id.description: The ID of the plan to create the task in

bucket_id.description: The ID of the bucket to create the task in

assignments.description: Object mapping Microsoft user IDs (GUIDs) to assignment objects. Example to assign to one user: {'be0e8cbe-6963-4c70-9daf-95518008ca51': {}} or with order hint: {'user-guid': {'orderHint': ' !'}}. Example for multiple users: {'user-guid-1': {}, 'user-guid-2': {}}. The @odata.type will be added automatically. IMPORTANT: Must use actual user IDs (get them via get_current_user, get_user_by_email, or search_users first), NOT email addresses or 'me'.

due_date_time.description: Due date and time in ISO 8601 format (e.g., '2024-12-31T17:00:00Z')

start_date_time.description: Start date and time in ISO 8601 format

priority.description: Priority of the task (0-10, where 0 is urgent and 10 is low)

applied_categories.description: Object mapping category names (category1-25) to boolean values indicating if the category is applied

error.description: Error message if the action failed

update_task.description: Update an existing task. IMPORTANT: To assign tasks, you must use actual Microsoft user IDs (GUIDs), not email addresses or 'me'. First call get_current_user (for 'me'), get_user_by_email, or search_users to get the user_id, then use that ID in the assignments field.

task_id.description: The ID of the task to update

title.description: The new title of the task

bucket_id.description: The ID of the bucket to move the task to

assignments.description: Updated assignments object mapping Microsoft user IDs (GUIDs) to assignment objects or null to remove. Example to assign: {'user-guid-here': {'orderHint': ' !'}} or simply {'user-guid-here': {}}. Example to unassign: {'user-guid-here': null}. The @odata.type will be added automatically. IMPORTANT: You must use actual user IDs (get them via get_current_user, get_user_by_email, or search_users actions first), NOT email addresses or 'me'.

due_date_time.description: Updated due date and time in ISO 8601 format

start_date_time.description: Updated start date and time in ISO 8601 format

applied_categories.description: Object mapping category names (category1-25) to boolean values

assignee_priority.description: Order hint for ordering tasks in assignee view

conversation_thread_id.description: ID of the conversation thread associated with the task

order_hint.description: Order hint for ordering tasks in list views
